alert.note: Alert for Orange County Inland; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 4:26AM PDT until August 21 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Orange County Coastal Areas, Orange County Inland Areas, San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire, San Diego County Coastal Areas, San Diego County Valleys and Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread heavy rainfall is expected to develop today, then decrease from south to north tonight. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Inland; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire
